txt.en: 'I thank you, [placeholder]. I have learned more than I hoped to, and I feel it has made me richer than anything else could have. Let me know if you are ready to go, and we can return to Duillond.'
'It cannot have been easy to find someone to solve my riddles for you!'
'Let us return to Duillond, [placeholder]. I have much to think about.'

'I am ready to see what Berenin left behind, [placeholder].'
'I do not understand.'
'This box is full of earth. There are small stones in the dirt.'
'There is a letter inside this box! A letter from Berenin!'
'Here is what the letter says.'
Berenin
Watch Isferon open the boxes and learn their secrets
'The third box is empty, for I leave its contents up to you.'
'When the time finally comes for you, too, to sail West...'
'I have gone on too long.'
'This, then, was my last gift to you, Isferon, though it is as much a gift for me.'
You have come to the cave where Isferon has been keeping the boxes left to him by Berenin.
'I wanted one last riddle-game with you, Isferon.'
'I hope you enjoyed it, and I will see you again. Good-bye, my friend!'
'Hail, Isferon!'
'Congratulations, first, on your success!'
'No, do not scowl! Written in jest, and with love, Isferon.'
'Why did I leave you these boxes? You must understand by now, surely!'
'Into the first box, I placed a handful of earth.'
'I wanted to remember the feel of that earth between my fingers forever.'
'You will understand someday.'
'Into the second box, I placed this letter.'
'You refused to speak to me today, but with this letter I can speak to you.'
'I have the three keys at the ready. Let us see what secrets Berenin left for me when he sailed into the West!'
